The workers in the large cities must act their several parts, making every effort to bring about the best results. They are to talk faith and to act in such a way as to 
                                                                           146
impress the people. They are not to narrow the work down to their own particular ideas. In the past too much of this has been done by us as a people, and it has been a drawback to the success of the work. Let us remember that the Lord has different ways of working, that He has different workmen to whom He entrusts different gifts. We are to see His purpose in the sending of certain men to certain places.
